plugin_desc: The IPMI collection plugin is a tool used for gathering hardware monitoring data from the device's IPMI, supporting remote monitoring of key metrics such as power status, temperature, fan speed, and voltage.
name: Storage

metrics.name: ipmi_chassis_power_state
metrics.description: The power state indicator is used to monitor if the device is powered on. Its value can indicate whether the power is on or off. It is mainly used for remote management and monitoring of the device's power state.

metrics.name: ipmi_power_watts
metrics.description: The power indicator is measured in watts and reflects the current power consumption of the device. This indicator helps evaluate the device's energy efficiency and power consumption trends. It facilitates the implementation of energy-saving policies and resource optimization.

metrics.name: ipmi_voltage_volts
metrics.description: The voltage indicator measured in volts monitors the voltage levels of different power rails within the device. Stable voltage supply is crucial for the reliability of the device. This indicator helps quickly identify electrical issues, ensuring normal operation.

metrics.name: ipmi_fan_speed_rpm
metrics.description: The fan speed indicator is measured in rotations per minute (rpm) and monitors the fan's operation status within the device. Efficient fan operation is key to maintaining device temperature. It helps prevent overheating and ensures the device's stable long-term operation.

metrics.name: ipmi_temperature_celsius
metrics.description: The temperature indicator measured in degrees Celsius monitors the internal temperature of the device. Monitoring temperature prevents heat accumulation and avoids device overheating. It is crucial for maintaining system stability and longevity.
